page.title: 02Farming at Cefn Stylle.
page.content: The farm that we visited was on the way to Penclawdd,about three miles from our school. There are three farms in one at this site,Cefn Stylle,Berthlwyd Uchaf and Pant y Cob.The farm covers 400 acres,half of which is tidal land which can be used to graze animals in the summer Mr Evans keeps 400 breeding ewes which in a good year produce about 600 lambs,The busiest time of year is in March and early April during the lambing season.It is not unusual for the farmer and his son to stay up all night to make sure the lambs are healthy and safe. There are 150 cows on the farm,they are bought at auction in the autumn.They are fed under shelter during the winter months to fatten them ready to sell to the butcher.
